00001 /* \file
00002 *  \brief micro-second(us) timer, source
00003 * 
00004 *  Functions for precise time measurements.
00005 * 
00006 *  29 March 2006<br />
00007 *  Sven Kreiss
00008 */
00009 
00010 
00011 
00012 #include "ustimer.h"
00013 
00014 volatile uint32_t us_time = 0;  
00015 
00016 
00017 
00018 
00021 void us_timer_init(void)
00022 {
00023     #define US_TIMER_PRESCALER 8    //for XTAL > 8 MHz
00024 
00025     TCCR3A = 0;                     //normal mode
00026     TCCR3B = (1<<CS31);             //Prescaler 8
00027     ETIMSK = (1<<TOIE3);            //enable Timer overflow interrupt
00028     TCNT3 = 0;
00029 }
00030 
00031 
00033 SIGNAL(SIG_OVERFLOW3)
00034 {
00035     if(us_time < 0xFFFF) us_time++; //with 16Bit-Timer use 0xFFFF; 8bit: 0xFFFFFF
00036     else us_time = 0;
00037 }
00038 
00039 
00040 
00043 uint32_t us_time_get(void)
00044 {
00045     return ((us_time << 16) + TCNT3);
00046 }
00047 
00048 
00049 
00057 uint32_t us_time_get_difference(uint32_t time1)
00058 {
00059     uint32_t time2;
00060     time2 = us_time_get();
00061     if(time2 >= time1) return (time2-time1);
00062     else return (0xFFFFFFFFF - (time1-time2)); //2^32
00063 }
00064 
00065 
00066 
00068 double us_time_get_difference_d(uint32_t time1)
00069 {
00070     return ((double)(us_time_get_difference(time1) * US_TIMER_PRESCALER) / (double)XTAL);
00071 }
